Example - Freezing Rows and Columns

This example shows how one can freeze rows and columns in a QicsTable widget. The View menu contains a dialog that allows the user to pop up dialogs to move selected rows and/or columns to the edges of the table, as well as a dialog that allows the user to freeze rows and columns.

The code in this example can be found in <QICSDIR>/examples/frozen.

For more information about freezing rows and columns, see HOWTO - Freezing Rows and Columns.

  • frozen.h Class Definitions
  • frozen.cpp Program Code
  • QicsFrozenConfigDialog.h Common dialog class used in multiple examples
  • QicsFrozenConfigDialog.cpp Common dialog class used in multiple examples
